criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: The problem statement clearly defines the issues that need to be addressed without ambiguity.

criteria.name: Relevance
criteria.description: The identified problems are directly relevant to the client's needs and business context.

criteria.name: Specificity
criteria.description: The problem statement contains specific details rather than vague generalities.

criteria.name: Comprehensiveness
criteria.description: The problem statement captures all significant aspects of the problem without major omissions.

criteria.name: Root Cause Identification
criteria.description: The problem statement identifies underlying causes, not just symptoms.

criteria.name: Research Foundation
criteria.description: The problem statement is well-supported by the research findings.

criteria.name: Prioritization
criteria.description: The problem statement effectively prioritizes issues based on impact and importance.

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: The problem is framed in a way that enables solution development and action.

criteria.name: Stakeholder Perspective
criteria.description: The problem statement considers the perspectives of all key stakeholders.

criteria.name: Neutrality
criteria.description: The problem statement avoids premature solution bias and remains solution-neutral.

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate the problem statement against each criterion. For each criterion, provide a score between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely failing to meet the criterion and 1.0 is perfectly meeting it. Provide specific feedback for scores below the pass threshold.
